Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the E-6 Mercury aircraft to improve mission capability and readiness.  All sixteen (16) aircraft, unless otherwise noted in the E-6 fleet will receive each modification.  The E-6 is a manned airborne communications platform designed to provide a survivable, endurable, and reliable airborne Command and Control Communications capability in support of the President, Secretary of Defense, and United States strategic and non-strategic forces.  

-Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  

-Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness and mandate compliance. 

-Service Life Extension Program (OSIP 003-07) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  

-Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) installs expanded aircraft digital communication paths and processing to improve airborne command post operations and modernizes direct over-the-horizon communications links to deployed strategic forces.  

-Block I (OSIP 008-10) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence. 

-Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.  

-Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) (OSIP 002-12) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  

-Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) (OSIP 014-14) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T and replaces Secure Emergency Conferencing Network with PNVC.  

-Mission Systems (OSIP 011-18) corrects mission systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) systems.

Justification.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $18.673 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $1.129 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: The Operational Safety Improvement Program corrects safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness. The OSIP also addresses Federal agency directives, aging aircraft material condition, and emergent safety hazards generated by the operational environment. Modifications include, but not limited to: Fuel Quantity Indicator System (FQIS) modification, Kapton wiring replacement, and other safety deficiencies that require correction; i.e. Crash Survivable Flight Indicator Recorder System (CSFIRS).

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FQIS kit buys PY-FY20; installations in PY-FY21. Aircraft Kapton NRE PY to beyond FYDP, buys and installs in PY to beyond FYDP. Kapton Lower Lobe, Wings, Engine Struts, and Tail are included in Kapton replacement efforts.

Name.@footnote: Other support in FY19 includes engineering and logistics support for engine covers and fuel tank sealant upgrade.

Name.val: 1.1.4) Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade A Kits - NonOrganic

Drive In:: Installation Name: AC Electrical A Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Technology Insertion corrects aircraft systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies as well as providing weight savings initiatives through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B.  Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems may be pursued.  Carbon Brakes integrates prior DoD-135/707 type brakes to the E-6B.  Seats integrates DoD approved mission seats to meet E-6B crash load requirements.  ADS-B Out integrates production COTs/GOTs to address civil navigation requirements by calendar year 2020.  Cockpit Update (CU) integrates follow on Boeing 737 and P-8A hardware to address obsolescence and additional civil navigation requirements.  Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade (FTSU) will utilize new commercially proven processes and materials to correct fuel system leaks caused by age and operational hours.  Aircraft (AC) Electrical will integrate updated technology to the aircraft power generation and distribution system to improve power quality and distribution, and reduce aircraft weight. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: Carbon Brakes NRE and kit buys completed in PY; with installs in PY-FY21 based on fleet aircraft availability. Seats NRE and kit buys completed in PY; with installs in FY17-FY20 based on fleet aircraft availability. ADS-B Out NRE completed in PY and kit buys PY-FY17; with organic installs. CU CNS/ATM compliance evaluation NRE in FY22 and CU NRE in FY23.  CU A-kit buys beyond FYDP; B kit buys beyond FYDP; with installs beyond FYDP. FTSU NRE in FY17-FY18; A-kit buys in FY19-FY23; with installs in FY19-FY23. Aircraft electrical NRE FY18-FY19; with A-kit buys FY21 to beyond FYDP; B-kit buys FY21 to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY21 to beyond FYDP. E-Told NRE FY17-FY18; with B-kit buys in FY18.

Name.@footnote: Other support cost in FY19-FY23 is for engineering and logistics support for SLEP Phase 1B installation.
IATS broken out from support line due to kit buys in FY17-FY18 and installs in FY18-FY19.
Non-Recurring Engineering funding in FY19 is for CSFIRs Phase 2 and SLEP Phase 1B.

Drive In:: Installation Name: CSFIR Phase 2 A Kits
Drive-In:: Installation Name: SLEP Phase 1B A Kits
Drive In:: Installation Name: IATS A Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening, structural data recording and analysis, and just in time modifications to prevent aircraft grounding due to fatigue.  Modifications include, but not limited to:  SLEP Phase 1; Individual Aircraft Tracking System (IATS); Crash Survivable Flight Incident Recorder System (CSFIRS) Phase 2; Runway Survey Analysis; and SLEP Phase 1B.  IATS will integrate the data collected from already installed Digital Flight Data Acquisition Unit (DFDAU) to support the Aircraft Structural Integrity Program along with data collected from a representative sample of E-6Bs (3 aircraft) during a limited period of time.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  SLEP Phase 1 NRE completed in PY, installation kit Production buys in PY-FY18 with installs in PY-FY18.  IATS NRE PY-FY18, kit buys and installs in FY17-FY19.  SLEP Phase 1B NRE FY17-FY18, kit buys FY18-FY22, and installs FY18 to beyond FYDP; CSFIRS Phase 2 NRE FY18-FY19, kit buys in FY20-FY22 and installs FY20-FY22.

Name.@footnote: Training cost in FY19-FY23 includes funding for MAST and WST trainers, courseware material, initial instructor training and MAST install in support of Satellite Communications (SATCOM).  Training cost in FY19-FY20 includes funding for various trainers/courseware in support of KGR-72, HPTS Technology Upgrade and HF-ALE.

Other support costs in FY19 supports IP Phase 1 and Phase 3 installation, which are conducted concurrently with Block I installation.  In addition, other support cost in FY19 - FY23 supports non-recurring engineering, Installation Data Package validation and verification during associated installs, and attendant logistics / training support requirements for KGR-72, HPTS HF-ALE and Wideband Satellite Communications (SATCOM).

Phase 1 installations are performed concurrently with Block I.  Due to the addition of significant aircraft maintenance workload during Block I installations, the final Phase 1 install has moved from FY18 to FY19.

Phase 3 installations are performed concurrently with Block I.  Due to the addition of significant aircraft maintenance workload during Block I installations, the final Phase 3 install has moved from FY18 to FY19.
Changed name of Common Very Low Frequency Receiver (CVLR) to KGR-72 to more accurately describe the effort.

Drive In:: Installation Name: Wideband Satellite Communication (SATCOM) A Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Installs expanded aircraft digital communication paths and processing to improve airborne command post operations and modernizes direct over-the-horizon communications links to deployed strategic forces.  Internet Protocol (IP) connectivity and wideband communication capability to enable voice, video and data services is mission critical to command and control operations.  Modifications include: IP Phase 1, International Marine/Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT); IP Phase 3, removal of Utility Trailing Wire Antenna (UTWA); Key Generator Receiver (KGR)-72; High Power Transmit Set (HPTS) Technology Upgrade , High Frequency Automatic Link Establishment (HF-ALE) replacement and integrate Commercial Wideband Satellite Communication (SATCOM) capability.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: IP Phase 1 production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY19. IP Phase 3 aircraft production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY19. IP Phases 1 and 3 installations will be completed concurrently with the Block I production program in PY-FY19. KGR-72 and HPTS Technology Upgrade NRE in FY17-FY20.  KGR-72 production kit buys FY19-FY23 with production installs in FY19-FY23. HPTS Technology Upgrade production kit buys FY20 to beyond FYDP and installs FY21 to beyond the FYDP. HF-ALE NRE FY18-FY19.  HF-ALE production kit buys FY19-FY23 and production installs in FY20 to beyond FYDP.  Commercial Wideband SATCOM program modifies 16 aircraft.  SATCOM NRE PY-FY17.  SATCOM Production kit buys FY17-FY18, installs FY18-FY19.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Block I corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence. Modifications include, but not limited to: Block I; Very Low Frequency (VLF) Transmit Terminal (VTT); and Technology Upgrade including Block, and Workstations.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Block I Systems Integration Lab (SIL) & aircraft (A/C) development kit installed in SIL FY06 and in A/C FY08; Milestone-C 3Q FY10; Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract award 3Q FY10; LRIP 1 kit buy in FY10 and 3 kit buys in FY11 with installs in FY11 and FY12 (4 A/C); Full-Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review achieved 2Q FY12. FRP kit buys PY-FY17 (11 A/C) with installs in PY-FY19. VTT Prototype SIL and A/C development kit delivery in FY11 with installation in FY12. SIL and A/C testing 2Q FY12 to 1Q FY13. VTT Production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY19 (15 A/C).

Name.@footnote: Other Support cost in FY19-FY22 supports the installs.
MR-TCDL FY19-FY22 installation schedule delays due to test aircraft and maintenance readiness issues unrelated to the modifications.

Name.val: MR-TCDL B Kit Equipment/Northrop Grumman Systems Corp

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: MR-TCDL Equipment B Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) is an Army program which developed production hardware that will be integrated into the E-6B aircraft. The E-6B MR-TCDL program performs the NRE to integrate MR-TCDL into the E-6B to support expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: E-6B MR-TCDL integration NRE PY-FY19. MR-TCDL Production A kit buys in PY-FY21 and B Kit buys in PY-FY21, with installs FY17-FY22.

Name.@footnote: Other support cost in FY19-FY22 is for engineering and logistics support for APU installation.
APU FY19-FY22 installation schedule delays due to test aircraft and maintenance readiness issues unrelated to the modifications.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: APU A Kit

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) incorporates safety, capacity and life-limiting propulsion and power corrective actions to resolve safety and readiness concerns.  Corrections to design deficiencies found during post production test and evaluation and discovered during fleet operations that have resulted in safety and reliability degradation that must be corrected.  The requirement to upgrade or modify the APU is critical in maintaining sustainable fleet reliability, safety, and performance and is necessary to meet established mission requirements.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  APU NRE PY-FY18, APU Kit buys PY-FY19; installations FY17-FY22.

ModificationTitle.val: Family of Adv Beyond-LI-of-Sight Term/Pres&Nat'l Voice Conf (FAB-T/PNVC)(OSIP 014-14)

FY18-FY22 engineering support for the kit development.  FY17-FY22 engineering support for software engineering upgrades and implementation.

Other Support costs in FY19 includes engineering and logistics support for production, installation, and specialized enterprise-wide flight follow-on test and evaluation.  Other Support costs in FY20-FY22 includes engineering and logistics support for production and installation.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In Modification:: Installation Name: FAB-T,  PNVC & RS Kit/Multiple

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals (FAB-T) and Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (PNVC) are U.S. Air Force programs of record and will be providing production hardware to the E-6B for integration into the aircraft. These systems are an obsolescence replacement for the currently installed Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals (MILSTAR). E-6B integration NRE for FAB-T and PNVC includes Red Switch (RS) integration, which is required for PNVC capability.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FAB-T/PNVC/RS NRE in PY-FY19. FAB-T A kit buys in PY-FY21; with installs in FY17-FY22. PNVC A kit buys in PY-FY21; B kit buys in FY18-FY20; with installs in FY17-FY22. RS A kit buys in PY-FY21; B kit buys in PY-FY21; with installs in FY17-FY22. Enterprise-wide follow-on test and evaluation in FY19-FY20.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: MOM A Kits
Drive In:: Installation Name: ALCS-R A Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Mission Systems corrects mission systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B. Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems may be pursued. Mission Operations Monitor (MOM) will update already installed E-6B systems with the ability to monitor and record critical parameters to ensure mission accomplishment and provide for accurate and timely post mission evaluations. Additional hardware for more robust monitoring may be added to the aircraft. Airborne Launch Control System-Replacement (ALCS-R) will integrate an Air Force procured system onto the E-6B to replace the current ALCS which is going obsolete. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: MOM NRE in FY23 to beyond FYDP. MOM A kit buys beyond FYDP. B kit buys beyond FYDP; with installs beyond FYDP. ALCS-R NRE in FY20-FY23. ALCS-R A kit buys in FY22 to beyond FYDP; B kit buys in FY22 to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY23 to beyond FYDP.
